A2 a device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something: an electric/oil/gas lamp a street lamp a table/bedside lamp See also
sunlamp
Ryan McVay/Photodisc/GettyImages
any of various devices that produce particular types of light: an infrared lamp
More examplesFewer examplesOw! - I got a shock from that lamp!They gave us a sunray lamp.A gap between the curtains admitted the faint glimmer of a street lamp.I switched on the lamp behind the armchair.I bought a new table lamp.

to punch someone (= hit them with your closed hand) hard: He managed to ignore the guy and walk away, instead of lamping him.
More examplesFewer examplesThe star was known for lamping photographers. I was being abused in a pub. I just lamped the geezer.Even if I got the better of him in an argument, I knew that I would just get lamped.Someone who did that around here would get lamped.
